page.title: 10THURLOW NUNN
page.content: The people who work at Thurlow Nunn call themselves agricultural engineers. The firm started in the name of Nunn 34 years ago in 1951. 17 years later in 1968 they joined up with another company called Thurlow and that's how they became Thurlow Nunn. They usally sell and repair Massey Fergussons and a small Japanese tractor called a Kubota. Overall they have 25 people working at Thurlow Nunn and only two of them are ladies. Agricultural engineers evolved from the village blacksmiths. There work involves: buying, selling, repairing and instructing farmers on how to use their machinery. Everyone at Thurlow Nunn seems to enjoy their work.
